document_data.caption: Shar saves herself and Naneatha with featherfall.
document_data.name: Feather Fall
document_data.mainbody: '''''Feather fall''''' (also written as '''''featherfall''''') was a [[spell]] that caused creatures or objects to fall slowly, like a feather.

Effects.Post-Spellplague: After the [[Spellplague]], this spell's effects lasted until the target touched the ground again. ''Feather fall'' was complex enough that its caster had to wait a day before casting it again.

document_data.Users: [[Beholder]]s had a [[permanent]] ''feather fall'' effect. [[Silver dragon]]s could use a ''feather fall'' [[spell]]-like ability.
document_data.History:
The [[Netherese]] [[arcanist]] [[Yturn]] was given for the credit for the creation of this spell in {{Yearlink|-1158}}, then known as '''''Yturn's feather fall'''''.<ref>

''Feather fall'' was a common spell in the Realms by the midâ€“14th century [[DR]].
document_data.Notable Uses: During the [[Time of Troubles]] in the [[1358 DR|Year of Shadows, 1358 DR]], [[Naneatha Suaril]] pushed the [[avatar]] of [[Shar]] off a high balcony of the [[House of the Moon]]. However, Shar cast ''featherfall'', causing both of them to land safely.{{Cite comic/Total Eclipse|8}} Later that year, the marauding [[Fellandar]] hurled the [[dwarf]] [[Onyx the Invincible]] high into the air. [[Kyriani]] caught him with a ''feather fall'' spell and brought him safely to earth.{{Cite comic/Summer in the City|6}}
